name: Sci-fi, surrealism and strangeness
description: Step through Portal 2 to explore the links between its sci-fi comedy and the world of film and TV.

key_work.title: Portal 2
key_work.brief_description: Portal 2 is an award-winning first-person puzzle adventure game, set in a crumbling science facility known as Aperture Labs.

end.title: Garth Marenghi's Darkplace
end.brief_description: When the Hellmouth opens beneath Darkplace Hospital in downtown Romford, kiddy doctor, Vietnam veteran and ex-warlock Dr. Rick Dagless M.D. (Garth Marenghi) is the only man who can close it. Joined by best buddy Dr. Lucien Sanchez (Todd Rivers), fiery hospital boss Thornton Reed (Dean Learner), and woman Liz Asher (Madeleine Wool), Dagless must fight the forces of Darkness while dealing with the burden of day-to-day admin. From the chilling pen of best-selling horror writer Garth Marenghi comes this lost masterpiece of televisual terror. Dare you enter Garth’s Darkplace?

constellations_other.name: Sci-fi, surrealism and strangeness
constellations_other.description: Step through Portal 2 to explore the links between its sci-fi comedy and the world of film and TV.

links.description: Portal 2 features the voice talents of Stephen Merchant and is a humorous take on science fiction tropes. Merchant also plays a key role in horror / supernatural spoof Garth Marenghi’s Darkplace.

start.title: Portal 2

end.title: Super 8
end.creator_credit: Bryan Burk, J.J. Abrams and Steven Spielberg
end.brief_description: In 1979 Ohio, several youngsters are making a zombie movie with a Super-8 camera. In the midst of filming, the friends witness a horrifying train derailment and are lucky to escape with their lives.

constellations_other.name: Splicing history and silencing the lambs
constellations_other.description: With plastic strips coated with light-sensitive emulsions, film strips captured light and created moving pictures. In this Constellation we trace celluloid and splicing as plot device to serial killers, secrets agents and Super 8.

constellations_other.name: Sci-fi, surrealism and strangeness
constellations_other.description: Step through Portal 2 to explore the links between its sci-fi comedy and the world of film and TV.

constellations_other.name: Making home movies
constellations_other.description: Home movies have inspired the form and plots of narrative cinema.

links.description: To promote the move of nostalgic supernatural adventure Super 8, an interactive teaser level of the train sequence from the film was included in Portal 2.

end.title: How to Talk to Girls at Parties
end.creator_credit: Neil Gaiman, Helen Scott, Emile Sherman, Iain Canning, John Cameron Mitchell, Howard Gertler and Little Punk
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2017
end.brief_description: Croydon, 1977. A trio of punk teenagers goes to a party to meet girls, but they find that girls there are very different from what they expected.

constellations_other.name: Sci-fi, surrealism and strangeness
constellations_other.description: Step through Portal 2 to explore the links between its sci-fi comedy and the world of film and TV.

links.description: After playing one of the intrepid kids who discover the alien in Super 8, actor Elle Fanning evolves into playing extraterrestrial life in punk sci-fi comedy How to Talk to Girls at Parties.

end.title: The Mighty Boosh
end.creator_credit: Spencer Millman, Steve Coogan and Henry Normal
end.brief_description: The Mighty Boosh is a British comedy television show created by Julian Barratt, Noel Fielding and others, that is best defined as a comic fantasy containing humour and pop-culture references.

constellations_other.name: Sci-fi, surrealism and strangeness
constellations_other.description: Step through Portal 2 to explore the links between its sci-fi comedy and the world of film and TV.

links.description: The Mighty Boosh is another surreal and comedic British supernatural series, featuring much of the same cast as Darkplace, including Noel Fielding, Julien Barret and Matt Berry.
